headline: Chef John's Baked Mushroom Risotto
description: Take the guesswork out of risotto with this recipe where the rice is started on the stove, baked halfway through the process, then finished with cheese and chives on the stove.

video.description: Chef John's rich, creamy risotto lets the oven do some of the work. Genius!
video.name: Chef John's Baked Mushroom Risotto

name: Chef John's Baked Mushroom Risotto

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Melt butter in large, oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms; season with salt, and cook and stir mushrooms until brown. They will begin browning after the moisture evaporates.
Reduce heat to medium and stir in onion. Sprinkle with black pepper and cayenne pepper. Cook and stir until onions are translucent and soft.
Pour rice into skillet and stir until each rice grain is coated with butter. Season with salt.
Pour 1 cup chicken broth into the rice mixture. Raise heat to medium-high and cook, stirring rice until liquid is completely absorbed by the rice.
Pour another cup chicken stock into the rice and stir until mixture comes to a simmer.
Bake in preheated oven until grains are almost tender but still slightly firm, about 15 minutes. Transfer skillet to stovetop. Season with more salt, if necessary.
Combine the remaining 1/2 cup chicken broth and cream; pour into the skillet. Cook on medium heat, stirring constantly until rice is tender, 1 or 2 minutes. Remove skillet from heat.
Drizzle 2 tablespoons cream over rice. Add the grated Parmigiano-Reggiano and chives; stir. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Chef John’s Baked Mushroom Risotto was delicious! I made it as directed and it turned out perfectly. The Risotto was creamy, rich and so flavorful. I usually make the Gourmet Mushroom Risotto from this site which we love as well. The preparation of stove-oven-stove resulted in a perfect texture Risotto.
Followed exactly!! Excellent!!My favorite mushroom dish of all time!!

Used two cups of rice. 6 cups od broth. Riley wasn’t here so would need to make more if he’s home. Didn’t do the oven part. Took a lot longer to cook; at least 45 minutes. Cooked mushrooms separate and added at the end. Was excellent.
Absolutely fabulous recipe!
6-21-22. First time making Rissoto and Just knew I could depend on Chef John to give me a winning recipe. Used arborio rice. This dish was absolutely delicious. Turned out perfect..

I've made this recipe so many times, I can't count the number. It's my "go-to" recipe and I've had a lot of fun coming up with variations. My favorite: add a clove or two of garlic along with the onions, and add 1/4 cup white wine in place of 1/4 cup of the first cup of stock. I sometimes replace the full cream with half-and-half and it's fine. This recipe is great with all kinds of mushrooms and stocks -- chicken, beef, veal, even vegetable stock. The only thing I don't change is the cheese. I have to have that real Parm!
I like spice, so add extra cayenne, it was delicious. grilled some salmon add put it on top of the risotto. cant wait to make it again
Delicious! Made with Arborio rice and whole milk (didn’t have cream on hand). Turned out fantastic. I will definitely make again!
This is restaurant quality, so delicious! I will definitely make this again!
O.M.G! I loved it. Added a little spinach and bell pepper and made it a one pan dinner.

First time ever making risotto, and I was skeptical, because I once went to a restaurant in the West Village with risotto in the NAME and it still came out poorly. This dish has a reputation for being tricky! However, as long as you follow the general technique, this is a very forgiving recipe and it was incredibly delicious. Like, it’s not even restaurant-quality risotto. More like high-end restaurant-quality risotto. I used baby Bella mushrooms and Arborio rice because I couldn’t find carnaroli. I also used some chopped basil in place of the chives. Added a couple extra shakes of cayenne. Also, I used my cast-iron skillet and it worked beautifully. So what to do for next time? This is pretty perfect and it would be hard to improve. I might try adding a bit of truffle oil for extra umami flavor, though.

Have made this several times and it is delicious. It is not hard. About 8 ounces of mushrooms is about 3 cups chopped. I make and freeze for later. It is very good with a cooked chicken breast mixed in. Hope you enjoy as much as we have.
Delicious risotto recipe. Nice creamy consistency.
Great recipe, used mushroom broth instead of chicken stock.

Made it and my husband really liked it. Added peppered sausage and broccoli. So good. Perfect creaminess and not soupy. I did use long grain rice and ended up adding 1/2 cup chicken stock after the initial 15 minutes in oven and put back in oven for additional 5 minutes. Came out great. Going to try adding shrimp the next time.

Best risotto I have ever eaten. I was very skeptical(because of the oven) but it exceeded my expectations. I had to add a little more chicken broth that it called for but other than that I made it exactly as written.

Popular dish! We added about 1 cup of fresh grated Parmesan! Next time we may have to double the recipe. We used 1 1/2 cups rice and 32 ounces of chicken broth plus 1/2 Cup heavy whipping cream. Really really delicious. This served our family of six, two adults two teens and a nine and 11 year old very as a side to a main chicken wings. We had no mushrooms so they were omitted.

I followed the directions as written, using Arborio rice. It was perfect! the cayenne gives just the right amount of heat and all of the rice was uniformly cooked. This was my first attempt at risotto and will definitely be making again.
I’ve made this multiple times for potlucks and it’s always a big hit! Tastes just like a “real” risotto without all the work.

This recipe is easy, delicious and creamy but be extra careful after taking the pan out of the oven. Out of habit, It's way too tempting to move the handle on the pan and burn your fingers. Chef John makes a great suggestion leave a towel on the pan handle and I suggest to enjoy the wine with dinner.
So easy to make. Well balanced taste.

I did this in my Instant Pot and it was amazing and only took about 12 minutes to make! I used the saute button and did steps 1-4 exactly. But for steps 5&6 I added 2 cups of the broth and pressure cooked for 4 minutes. I did a quick release and finished with steps 8&9. It was perfectly delicious!!
This is a great recipe, the hubby and I loved it.
Love this! Can't stop eating it. YUM
This is my favorite Chef John recipe so far. I've made this twice now using arborio rice but otherwise following the instructions as listed. Came out perfect each time. So good!
This was delicious!! I used baby bella mushrooms and Texas sweet onions. Served alongside a simple seasoned thick boneless pork chop. My hubby swooned!
This dish was superb and phenomenally easy. My family loves mushroom risotto and this got rave reviews. I made it exactly as written. Next time I might try adding a drizzle of truffle oil!

This came out perfect. I followed the recipe as written. I did use Arborio rice though. I did not add to much salt. For those reviewers that said the rice was to hard, I think that either you cooked out a little to much of the liquid before putting it in the oven or did not cook it long enough in the oven. Just a minute or two can make a big difference. I will be making this again.

The risotto was perfect! Followed the recipe exactly but, like other reviewers, did not add any additional salt - I used salted butter and the chicken broth has plenty of sodium. I did chop up about 4 cups of fresh baby spinach and stirred it in for the last two minutes of cooking. Would also be fantastic with some halved cherry tomatoes! *note, I have also successfully made this using regular white rice. Not quite as creamy, but still very tasty!

Really delicious. Chef John knocked it out of the park again. I generally followed the recipe, but didn’t measure everything (i used the mushrooms & onions on hand). Paired with barbecued shrimp so I used a bit of shrimp broth with the chicken broth. As a heads up, I needed extra broth at the end as rice wasn’t quite done. Everybody loved it.
I made this for our Italian exchange student and she said it was perfect!
Excellent and SO easy!

This turned out great. Watch Chef John's video before making this. In it he gives an essential tip: drape a towel over the pan handle after removing it from the oven. Otherwise you may be tempted to grasp the 400 degree handle as I did. Ouch! 

Other than that, it came together nicely. After burning my hand, I had to get my wife to finish it so we cooked it a little long and the risotto was a little drier than I had intended. It finishes quickly so watch the consistency near the end so you can remove it from the heat when it looks like you want it to.

In any case, it is delicious. I could not find carnaroli rice (went to WalMart and Publix) so I substituted Arborio rice as Chef John suggested. Other than that, I made it as in the recipe. I recommend it highly. I served it with a baked Cornish Hen. Wish I had cooked two so I could have the 2nd one with the leftover mushroom risotto. Yum!
Wonderful

I was looking for a good risotto recipe that was yummy and easy to make and having tried some of chef John’s recipes in the past I figured that I was going to give it a try, so one of the only things that I have changed was the salt amount that was added and used Himalayan sea salt in stead of the white table salt. And I would have used a little more chicken stock, I used chicken stock in stead of broth because it ha?s a much richer flavor. And I added shallots instead of yellow onions gave it a different flavor, and I used shredded Parmesan cheese. I’m going to say that I’m very happy with how the risotto turned out minus the little under cooked rice but was really good in the end.
Made as directed except for subbing Arborio rice because that's what I had. Delicious. Even my husband, who's not a fan, finished a bowl. Company worthy.
Easy and very good. No changes made.
Amazing recipe! Cooked it with my Tefal cuisine companion and added 80ml of white wine :) couldn't be happier with the outcome.

Took to a Christmas Party, the main course of Roast Beef. It was a huge hit... I was actually quite proud of myself, thank you Chef John! 

I did not change anything other that the serving amount and adjusted as needed. It was very easy and quicker to make than I thought it would be. Absolutely delicious and I will make this more often.

There are more steps and babysitting than one might care for on a busy weeknight, but it was worth the work. Chef John might hate me, but this was even more delicious the next day, slowly warmed in the microwave with many pauses for stirring.
This was incredible. My first risotto. my boyfriend said it was the best thing I have ever made him!

So very easy, so very delicious! Can always count on Chef John. Made exactly as written, but did have tosub Risoto for the Carnaroli rice (our small city groceries don't seem to carry the carnaroli). Can't imagine the flavor was diminished by the substitution. Will definitely make it again!
Holy Risotto! This could not have been easier. Absolutely delicious!
Made it already a few times. Best risotto Ive tasted yet. I salute Chef John.
Followed the recipe exactly. It was super delicious!
I added about a half cup of whipping cream. It was delish!!
Awesome!
I’ve made this recipe at least a dozen times now and it is always a hit. Simple and delicious. Better than most risottos I’ve had at even the best restaurants.
yum, just right!
I have made this many times with great reviews always! It is perfect as written.

My first review ever and I had to because this is that good! Made it exactly as written and it turned out perfectly. I’m a big meat eater but trying to eat at least one no meat dinner a week. My wife and I had this last night with a side of asparagus and I told her this could be in my top 10 dishes of all time. Me, the carnivore! At any rate, my saved recipes is crammed with Chef John ones because his are the best!!

This was delicious even though I made quite a few changes, I subbed the butter for oil, used leftover jasmine rice, subbed chives for green onions, reduced the liquids, added flour to the cream and left out the parmesan. This still turned out great and I'd gladly make it again!
As good as any risotto I have ever had and I've had a lot. I followed the recipe exactly.
Only change I made was using salted butter since that’s all I had. It was so delicious! Good enough to eat alone!
Absolutely yummy and so easy do make. My family loved it and this recipe has already been saved to my favorites!!
Dynamite recipe. Chef John is so good. My family loved it. Its a keeper around my home now.
I am new to "recipe cooking" but this is truly amazing!
So easy, so good. Will definitely be making this again. Loved the oven technique. Didn't change a thing.
I have now made this several times to serve guests and each time the reviews have been 5 star!! Best with homemade chicken stock.

Wow! I'm almost speechless. Chef John is brilliant time and time again. Made this with regular white rice and it turned out wonderful. The video was a perfect vehicle to show the consistencies of the sauce at all stages. I just followed the vid until my pan looked like his. Could not have been easier. Thanks again, Chef John!
I literally make this at least once a month.
This has become a family favorite. It's so easy and tasty I don't change a thing.
Incredible! A rich and deep flavor that goes on forever. So creamy and delicious!

We had just ended a cleanse and wanted something vegetarian, I was skeptical about making Risotto as a number of Top Chef contestants bombed this one. Chef John's recipe was straight forward, simple and tasty. So far I have made in twice and nailed it both times.
Delicious!!
Very easy recipe to follow. After tasting, I wondered what took me so long to make!
Easy and delicious as is!
This is yummo and easy!!!
This is one of the best Risottos I have had! Excellent flavor, easy to make!
Never fails. We have this memorized.
Very delicious and relatively easy for risotto!

Another great recipe from Chef John! This was delicious. Packed with flavor! I did add/make minor changes. I used white wine in place of chicken broth on 2nd round of adding liquids. I added fresh parsley and some basil. I added some minced garlic while cooking mushrooms and onions. I added shrimp (i cooked the shrimp in some chicken broth before i started risotto and then set it aside). Lastly...i added a little Asiago cheese at the end with the parm cheese. It was so incredibly yummy! You can really do so much with this recipe!! I watched Chef John's cooking video a couple times before starting. I think that helped me. This was my first time cooking Risotto. I was terrified...but it turned out perfect. Just follow his instructions and you'll be alright!
I actually prefer to make risotto the old fashioned way, and this recipe worked like a charm on the stovetop. The proportions of the ingredients are on point. Great and versatile recipe!

I have never made risotto before. Followed instructions and the rice was cooked to perfection. Very flavourful. Used salted butter and chicken stock so did not need as much salt to flavour. Excellent!
This was great! I’ve never made risotto before but this was so easy. I think what helped is I had everything cut and measured before I started cooking. Will definitely make again.

Delicious!!!! I didn’t use cayenne. I thought it came out perfect. Can’t wait to make this for my boyfriend tomorrow. Update: it’s been almost five years of making this risotto. I made it last night for Christmas, doubled the batch. Everyone loved it!

Yet another outstanding recipe from Chef John!!! Made as is and it turned out amazing!! LOVE the (15) min. of 'free' time while it's in the oven, where traditional risotto recipes require constant babysitting!
Love this! One of our favorites! Used arborio rice because it's what I could find and a mixture of mushrooms. Will definitely make again and again!
The perfect recipe. Easy ingredients, quick, and delicious!

Made as instructed with the exception of adding white wine. I added half of a cup in step 3. Worked well, but might wait until step 6 next time for a little more wine flavor. Family raved about this dish! May try and add in some asparagus and shrimp next time as a main dish.
Awesome but I make it with orzo. So creamy and really delicious. Use organic chicken broth, half the butter and no additional salt. Love it!
No changes. I’m a fan of risotto now!
This was incredible! I can't wait to make this again for company, they'll be so impressed. Thank you!!
So delicious, and so easy! This will be my go-to risotto recipe from now on.

We love this recipe! We make it at least once a month. I am unable to eat cheese or cream, so I just use more chicken broth or white wine, and my family adds cheese to their own servings. It is delicious even without the cheese and cream. Easy to make. Love it! Thank you, Chef John!!

I have tried a number of Chef John's recipes and have found them to be dependable. This one merits a review. I followed the recipe exactly as written and the outcome was amazing. The carnaroli rice is expensive, but worth every penny, considering this risotto is superior to that served in many restaurants. Make this for company and enjoy the accolades.

This risotto was so wonderful. It was my first time making a risotto and this was easy to follow and due and come out wonderfully. Although that is usually true of all Chef John's recipes. I did omit the cayane and I couldn't find the rice he mentions but used the standard standby risotto rice and it worked out great. The mushroom flavor is superb! We served it with steak and artichokes and made for a wonderful meal.
Used milk instead of heavy cream and red pepper flakes instead of cayenne. Will definitely make again.
Made no changes except I didn't add the extra two tablespoons of cream at the end. Still great, will make again.
Easy to make and very tasty!

WOW! Nervous first time risotto maker but I am 100% a believer! This recipe was amazing and a lot easier than I expected. I followed exactly as is and made in my dutch oven which made it really easy and never stuck. Had the leftovers in a bacon and egg scramble! Delicious!!

I tweaked a bit to what I had, but the concepts and oven tip I used, turned out perfect all family loved even my little 1 and half year baby too she loved even every tiny rice fighting over and she is very fussy eater but that's a fav :):), I didn't have stock at time but the chicken stock powder seasoning did just as well with water to substitute , with the black pepper etc as recipie, I found it didn't need the extra time after the oven or the Parmesan and extra cream it was sooo perfect and tasty as it came out and texture perfect and saucy,, just a note I added diced chicken to the sautéed onions then the white mushroom in this order in the begging and they came out perfect texture too :) thanks for this recipe Because I can be flexible with and think outside the box when need be :) Also u should eat right away for the sauce otherwise would dry out and not as cool,, enjoy right away :)

Excellent, as always from Chef John. I omitted the cream and simply used more broth, as I did not have cream and was trying to use up some broth and use some of my plentiful chives. It turned out very tasty. I had no salt in my broth, so I used a cube of chicken bullion as the added salt. I doubt I will make risotto using any other method moving forward.

Was trying to decide what to make as a side for my vegetarian daughter and voila! Chef John to the rescue again. She loved it! I added a little white wine and used half and half instead of cream as that is what I had and I used Arborio rice as I could not find carnaroli rice. I used home made vegetable stock. It was fabulous. Thanks Chef John. I will never slave over a pan of risotto again.
Excellent recipe! I followed directions exactly except I substituted veggie broth for chicken to make it vegetarian. Turned out great!
Very easy to make and we enjoyed it. I will make it again for sure. Thanks Chef John.
This was excellent. I made it for a vegetarian family member, so I substituted mushroom broth for chicken broth. Much loved by all!

The only thing different I did was to change the chicken broth to organic vegetable broth. This is an excellent recipe and was a big hit for Sunday dinner along with Chef John's recipe for short ribs. Will make both again.
Very good. Replaced the cream with cream of chicken soup and milk to make it a little lighter. Very good!! Definitely something to make again.
